New Records: Cooper Criswell retired 12 consecutive Tigers to start the game, a significant performance.
Spencer Torkelson hit a go-ahead two-run homer in the fifth inning, marking a key moment in the game.
Key Match Events: Cooper Criswell pitched 4 perfect innings before being pulled in the fifth inning.
Alex Cora's decision to replace Criswell with Rich Hill led to a critical two-run homer by Spencer Torkelson.
The game featured a strong pitching performance by Boston's starters, but struggles at the plate proved costly.
Post-Match Reflections: Boston manager Alex Cora acknowledged the pitching staff's strong performance but pointed to the bats' struggles as the losing factor.
Spencer Torkelson's two-run homer was a turning point in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Red Sox are 4.5 games back in the AL Wild Card standings after the loss.
Boston's next opportunity to secure a win will come in a three-game series against the Mets starting Monday night.
